senses.de: To evaluate or estimate the nature, ability, or value of something
senses.ex: Teachers are always assessing their students' progress

Tips.title: Subjective Judgment
Tips.description: Assessing often involves personal judgment or opinion, especially in contexts like education or performance reviews.
Tips.example: After watching the play, the critic assessed the actors' performances.

Tips.title: Ongoing Process
Tips.description: Assessment can be continuous, such as in a workplace where managers regularly assess employees' work.
Tips.example: The coach assesses the team's tactics after every game.

Tips.title: Broad Applications
Tips.description: The verb 'assess' is used across various fields, from education to business to healthcare.
Tips.example: The doctor assessed the patient's symptoms before making a diagnosis.

senses.de: To charge or ask someone to pay a specific amount as a tax, fee, or penalty
senses.ex: The city decided to assess a 3% tax on alcoholic beverages

Tips.title: Official Requirement
Tips.description: In legal and technical contexts, 'assess' means authorities determine payments like taxes or fines.
Tips.example: The court assessed damages against the defendant.

Tips.title: Mandatory Payments
Tips.description: Assessed amounts must often be paid as they are official, like a property tax bill or court fee.
Tips.example: After the audit, the IRS assessed additional taxes.

Tips.title: Precise Calculation
Tips.description: When officials assess fees or taxes, they use specific rules or criteria to calculate the amount.
Tips.example: The council assessed a fee for waste disposal based on property size.

senses.de: To calculate or think about what will be required for a situation
senses.ex: The engineers are assessing the work needed to repair the bridge

Tips.title: Planning Ahead
Tips.description: 'To assess' in strategic planning means to consider what resources or actions are needed for the future.
Tips.example: We need to assess our team's training requirements for the upcoming project.

Tips.title: Analyzing Needs
Tips.description: Assessing needs means to look closely at what is necessary or lacking in a certain area or situation.
Tips.example: The charity assessed the community's needs to provide targeted aid.

Tips.title: Anticipating Challenges
Tips.description: Assessing sometimes involves predicting difficulties that may arise and preparing accordingly.
Tips.example: The engineer assessed potential challenges before the construction began.

Analyse.wordDefinition:
Both words "analyze" and assess involve the process of examining something, but they have different meanings and applications.

"Analyze" means to break something down into smaller parts and examine each part closely to understand it better. It involves looking at the details and trying to find patterns and connections between them.

For example, a scientist might analyze a new chemical compound to determine its properties and how it reacts with other substances.

To "analyze" is to take something apart to understand it better, while to assess is to evaluate or judge it based on certain criteria.

Appraise.wordDefinition:
The words appraise and assess both mean to evaluate something, but they are used in different situations.

Appraise is used when determining the value or worth of something, usually in terms of money. For example, a real estate appraiser might appraise the value of a home before it is sold.

Appraise is used when figuring out how much something is worth, while assess is used when evaluating something's quality or condition.

Determine.wordDefinition:
Assess means to evaluate or analyze something, while determine means to make a decision or come to a conclusion.

Determination is more about making a decision or taking action based on the information gathered. For example, a doctor might determine the best course of treatment for a patient after assessing their symptoms and medical history.

In summary, assessing is about evaluating and understanding, while determining is about making decisions and taking action.

Estimate.wordDefinition: Estimate means to give an approximate calculation or prediction of something's value or quantity. It's like guessing how long it will take to finish a task or how much money something will cost.

Evaluate.wordDefinition:
Assess and evaluate both mean to judge or analyze something, but they are used in different ways.

Evaluate is used to judge the quality or value of something. For example, you might evaluate a performance or artwork to determine its effectiveness or artistic merit.

You might also evaluate a product to determine if it meets certain standards or if it is worth the price.

Assess is more about measuring or estimating while evaluate is more about judging or determining value.

Gauge.wordDefinition:
Gauge means to estimate or measure something, usually with a tool or instrument.

But if you wanted to know how hot the oven was, you would gauge the temperature with a thermometer.

Judge.wordDefinition:
Judging refers to forming an opinion or conclusion about someone or something without considering facts or with bias. It is a subjective approach, and personal beliefs or values can influence the judgment.

Assess is applicable when there is an objective evaluation needed, while judge is more suitable when someone has to form a subjective opinion.

For example, a teacher would assess a student's assignment based on academic criteria, while a person may judge someone's appearance or behavior based on their personal beliefs.

Rate.wordDefinition:
Rate means to assign a value, rank or position to someone or something based on a particular standard of measurement.

So, while assess involves looking at something carefully and forming an opinion, rate involves assigning a value or position based on specific standards.

Both words can be used in many contexts, but assess is more commonly used in professional contexts, while rate is more commonly used in everyday life.

Review.wordDefinition:
Review means to examine something in order to provide an opinion or summary. It involves looking at the bigger picture and considering multiple aspects, such as strengths, weaknesses, and overall effectiveness.

Reviews are often used in consumer contexts, such as reviewing products or services for the purpose of making purchasing decisions.

In summary: Assessing is about evaluating something with specific criteria, while reviewing involves examining something to provide an overall opinion or summary.

quotes.Text: Being a pop star is something I don't think I'm very good at. I'm worried it's making me too paranoid, because all of a sudden, life has become this constant assessment. When you put something out there and people get to hear it, then those people react to it, socially, culturally.
quotes.Title: British Musician
quotes.Name: Laura Mvula

quotes.Text: I enjoy the process of assessing, analyzing it and even as a professional I still think it's very wise to allow the fan in you to continue to remain alive. The professional always has to come first, but the fan in you allows you to relate to what people are watching.
quotes.Title: American Wrestler
quotes.Name: Karrion Kross

quotes.Text: If I'm preparing for something and I've got a huge day the next day, I have to get into character the night before to assess the scene. I can't assess a scene unless I'm in character, if that makes sense.
quotes.Title: English Actress
quotes.Name: Samantha Morton

quotes.Text: I think kids should have a mentor and a role model, but that they shouldn't take one person's opinion to be what we call final assessment or judgment about how life is supposed to be.
quotes.Title: Jamaican Musician
quotes.Name: Sean Paul

quotes.Text: When threatened, the nervous system sometimes goes into a 'freeze response.' You assess the risk and determine that fight or flight doesn't help you. Staying put does.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Nell Scovell

quotes.Text: I was quite fearless as a kid. But I've had to realize I'm not invincible. That's what breaking your back does. It makes you grow up and reassess life.
quotes.Title: English Actor
quotes.Name: Orlando Bloom

quotes.Text: We're professional athletes, and we have moments where we step back, and we have to think and assess everything in life.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Nick Foles

quotes.Text: We tune in to news companies for them to give us some sense of grounded assessment of what the truth is.
quotes.Name: Sam Seder

quotes.Text: I made my own assessment of my life, and I began to live it. That was freedom.
quotes.Title: Chilean Politician
quotes.Name: Fernando Flores

quotes.Text: The reserve strength is very important in assessing a team's ability.
quotes.Title: Trinidadian Cricketer
quotes.Name: Brian Lara
